data.text:
Gerald Green

Class:

Senior

Hometown:

Gilbert, Ariz.

Last College:

Mesa Community College

Height / Weight:

5-9 / 190

Position:

Tailback

ASU: Tough and quick back who sees the whole field ... can slip through the smallest of holes ... a good complement to J.R. Redmond ... will receive significant playing time ... catches the football well out of the backfield. 1998: Saw his first action as a Sun Devil in the 34-15 win over North Texas ... had nine carries for 35 yards, with a long of 12 yards ... gave ASU two first downs in the third-quarter drive that led to the Sun Devils' fourth touchdown of the game ... carried the ball 17 times for a game-high 86 rushing yards in ASU's 24-3 rout of Oregon State ... averaged 5.1 yards per carry with a 14-yard long ... had three carries for 13 yards, including an eight-yard long at USC ... scored the first touchdown of the game on a one-yard run in the first quarter ... had 11 carries for 83 yards for a 3.9 yard-per-carry average against Notre Dame ... had an 11-yard carry in the second quarter which gave ASU a first down and eventually led to the Sun Devils' first points of the game ... carried the ball 16 times for 72 yards, a 4.5-yard average, in ASU's 44-38 overtime win over Stanford ... rushed for 23 yards to the Stanford 40 on first and 10 in the third quarter ... on that drive, ASU scored a field goal to tie the game at 24 ... also had one 23-yard kickoff return ... had 26 carries for 119 yards in the Sun Devils' 38-28 win at Washington State ... was the first 100-yard effort of his Sun Devil career ... averaged 4.6 yards per carry ... had carries of 25, seven and five yards in ASU's first scoring drive of the game ... also recovered a fumble at the Cougar 46 in the third quarter ... carried the ball 14 times for 29 yards in the Sun Devils' 55-22 rout of California ... also had a 33-yard kickoff return ... left the game with a hurt shoulder in the first quarter, but returned in the second quarter ... did not play at Oregon due to a shoulder injury ... returned to action at Arizona, but only carried the ball twice.

JUNIOR COLLEGE: Rushed for 515 yards at Eastern Arizona C.C.... transferred to Mesa C.C., redshirting in 1996... as a team captain in 1997, had 738 rushing yards, 216 receiving yards and was named the Mesa C.C. Student Academic Athlete of the Year.

HIGH SCHOOL: A 1995 graduate of Mesa High School... rushed for 1,533 yards his senior year, scoring 19 touchdowns and amassing a slew of personal accolades, including: 5A Central Region Player of the Year, Arizona Offensive Player of the Year by Friday Night Fever and First team all-Arizona.

PERSONAL: Major is sociology... father is Ken Marshall... has two sisters, McKenna Marshall (5) and Krysten Marshall (2)... cousin is Kevin Miniefield, ASU football player from 1989-1992... full name is Gerald A. Green.

CAREER HIGHS: Rushing Attempts: 26, at Washington State (10/31/98). Rushing Yards: 119, at Washington State (10/31/98). Touchdowns: 1, at USC (10/3/98). Longest Rush: 25, at Washington State (10/31/98).

Green's Career Statistics

G/GS Att. Yds. Avg. TD Long 1998 8/1 98 416 4.0 1 25 Career 8/1 98 416 4.0 1 25
